transformlib package¶

class transformlib.Input(relative_path: Path | str)[source]¶

Bases: Node

An Input is a source in a directed asyclic graph of data transformations.

class transformlib.Node(relative_path: Path | str)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Node base class is a node in a directed asyclic graph of data transformations.

relative_path¶

The path relative to config.DATA_DIR where data associated with the node is saved or loaded from.

Type:

Path | str

property data_dir: Path¶

The root directory where all data is saved and loaded relative to.

property path: Path¶

The path to the node in the directory config.DATA_DIR.

class transformlib.Output(relative_path: Path | str)[source]¶

Bases: Node

An Output is a sink in a directed asyclic graph of data transformations.

class transformlib.Pipeline(transforms: list[Transform] | dict[str, Transform] | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A Pipeline is a topologically ordered list of transformlib.Transform objects.

A transformlib.Pipeline can be run from the command line:

transform path/to/transforms/*.py
transform -v path/to/transforms/*.py

This will topologically sort and run all transformlib.Transform objects found in the .py files.

classmethod from_paths(paths: list[str] | list[Path])[source]¶

Initialize a transformlib.Pipeline from all :py:class:`transformlib.Transform`(s) found in a list of path(s) to .py files.

As part of this initialization the parent folder to each path is appended to PYTHONPATH.

property inputs: list[Input]¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Input of the transformlib.Pipeline.

property nodes: list[Input | Output]¶

All :py:class:`transformlib.Output`(s) and :py:class:`transformlib.Input`(s).

property outputs: list[Output]¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Output of the transformlib.Pipeline.

run() → None[source]¶

Used to run all the transformlib.Transform`(s) in the :py:class:`transformlib.Pipeline.

property tasks: list[Transform]¶

A topologically sorted list of :py:class:`transformlib.Transform`(s) in the Pipeline.

class transformlib.Transform(output_kwargs: dict[str, Output], function: Any, input_kwargs: dict[str, Input], parameter_kwargs: dict[str, Parameter] | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Used to organize transformations of data.

A transformlib.Transform is a many to many mapping between transformlib.Input and transformlib.Output nodes.

output_kwargs¶

A mapping from Output name to Output instance.

Type:

dict[str, Output]

function¶

A function that contains the data transformation logic used to load and transform the transformlib.Input nodes and save the output to the transformlib.Output nodes.

Type:

Function

input_kwargs¶

A mapping from Input name to Input instance.

Type:

dict[str, Input]

parameter_kwargs¶

A mapping from Parameter name to Parameter instance.

Type:

dict[str, Parameter]

property inputs: list[Input]¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Input`(s) to the :py:class:`transformlib.Transform.

property nodes: list[Input | Output]¶

All :py:class:`transformlib.Output`(s) and :py:class:`transformlib.Input`(s).

property outputs: list[Output]¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Output`(s) of the :py:class:`transformlib.Transform.

run() → None[source]¶

Runs the Transform.

exception transformlib.TransformlibCycleException[source]¶

Bases: CycleError

Raised when there is a cycle in the transformlib.Pipeline.

Raised when there is duplicate Output in the transformlib.Pipeline.

exception transformlib.TransformlibDuplicateTransformException[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when there is duplicate Transform in the transformlib.Pipeline.

transformlib.transform(**kwargs: Input | Output | Parameter) → Callable[[Any], Transform][source]¶

Convert a function to a transformlib.Transform.

A Transform is often constructed using the transformlib.transform() decorator:

import json
from transformlib import transform, Output, Input


@transform(
    json_output=Output('mapping.json'),
    txt_input=Input('mapping.txt'),
)
def convert_to_json(json_output, txt_input):
    text = txt_input.path.read_text()
    mapping = dict(map(lambda line: line.split(','), text.splitlines()))
    json_output.path.write_text(json.dumps(mapping, indent=4))

In above example the convert_to_json is a transformlib.Transform object that can be part of a transformlib.Pipeline of many transformations.

Parameters:

**kwargs (dict[str, Node]) – The transformlib.Input and transformlib.Output nodes of the transform.

Returns:

A decorator that returns a Transform object.

Return type:

Callable[[Function], Transform]
